intro: Myrsine retusa, commonly known as the rough myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a rough or hairy texture. The small white or pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and the plant produces small, fleshy berries that are edible.
